fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its ID

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: agencies
fields.description: Get all agencies for the specified graph

fields.name: agency
fields.description: Get a single agency based on agency ID

fields.name: stops
fields.description: Get all stops for the specified graph

fields.name: stopsByBbox
fields.description: Get all stops within the specified bounding box

fields.name: stopsByRadius
fields.description: Get all stops within the specified radius from a location. The returned type has two fields stop and distance

args.name: lat
args.description: Latitude of the location

args.name: lon
args.description: Longitude of the location

args.name: radius
args.description: Radius (in meters) to search for from the specidied location

fields.name: stop
fields.description: Get a single stop based on its id (format is Agency:StopId)

fields.name: station
fields.description: Get a single station (stop with location_type = 1) based on its id (format is Agency:StopId)

fields.name: routes
fields.description: Get all routes for the specified graph

fields.name: route
fields.description: Get a single route based on its id (format is Agency:RouteId)

fields.name: trips
fields.description: Get all trips for the specified graph

fields.name: trip
fields.description: Get a single trip based on its id (format is Agency:TripId)

fields.name: patterns
fields.description: Get all patterns for the specified graph

fields.name: pattern
fields.description: Get a single pattern based on its id

fields.name: clusters
fields.description: Get all clusters for the specified graph

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: Get a single cluster based on its id

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: Get all alerts active in the graph

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Needed until https://github.com/facebook/relay/issues/112 is resolved

fields.name: plan
fields.description: Gets plan of a route

args.name: from
args.description: The start location

args.name: to
args.description: The end location

args.name: wheelchair
args.description: Whether the trip must be wheelchair accessible.

args.name: numItineraries
args.description: The maximum number of itineraries to return.

args.name: maxWalkDistance
args.description: The maximum distance (in meters) the user is willing to walk. Defaults to unlimited.

args.name: maxPreTransitTime
args.description: The maximum time (in seconds) of pre-transit travel when using drive-to-transit (park and ride or kiss and ride). Defaults to unlimited.

args.name: walkReluctance
args.description: A multiplier for how bad walking is, compared to being in transit for equal lengths of time. Defaults to 2. Empirically, values between 10 and 20 seem to correspond well to the concept of not wanting to walk too much without asking for totally ridiculous itineraries, but this observation should in no way be taken as scientific or definitive. Your mileage may vary.

args.name: waitReluctance
args.description: How much worse is waiting for a transit vehicle than being on a transit vehicle, as a multiplier. The default value treats wait and on-vehicle time as the same. It may be tempting to set this higher than walkReluctance (as studies often find this kind of preferences among riders) but the planner will take this literally and walk down a transit line to avoid waiting at a stop. This used to be set less than 1 (0.95) which would make waiting offboard preferable to waiting onboard in an interlined trip. That is also undesirable. If we only tried the shortest possible transfer at each stop to neighboring stop patterns, this problem could disappear.

args.name: waitAtBeginningFactor
args.description: How much less bad is waiting at the beginning of the trip (replaces waitReluctance on the first boarding)

args.name: walkSpeed
args.description: max walk speed along streets, in meters per second

args.name: bikeSpeed
args.description: max bike speed along streets, in meters per second

args.name: bikeSwitchTime
args.description: Time to get on and off your own bike

args.name: bikeSwitchCost
args.description: Cost of getting on and off your own bike

args.name: optimize
args.description: The set of characteristics that the user wants to optimize for -- defaults to QUICK, or optimize for transit time.

args.name: triangle
args.description: Triangle optimization parameters. triangleTimeFactor+triangleSlopeFactor+triangleSafetyFactor == 1

args.name: arriveBy
args.description: Whether the trip should depart at dateTime (false, the default), or arrive at dateTime.

args.name: intermediatePlaces
args.description: An ordered list of intermediate locations to be visited.

args.name: preferred
args.description: Preferred

args.name: unpreferred
args.description: Unpreferred

args.name: walkBoardCost
args.description: This prevents unnecessary transfers by adding a cost for boarding a vehicle.

args.name: bikeBoardCost
args.description: Separate cost for boarding a vehicle with a bicycle, which is more difficult than on foot.

args.name: banned
args.description: Banned

args.name: transferPenalty
args.description: An extra penalty added on transfers (i.e. all boardings except the first one). Not to be confused with bikeBoardCost and walkBoardCost, which are the cost of boarding a vehicle with and without a bicycle. The boardCosts are used to model the 'usual' perceived cost of using a transit vehicle, and the transferPenalty is used when a user requests even less transfers. In the latter case, we don't actually optimize for fewest transfers, as this can lead to absurd results. Consider a trip in New York from Grand Army Plaza (the one in Brooklyn) to Kalustyan's at noon. The true lowest transfers route is to wait until midnight, when the 4 train runs local the whole way. The actual fastest route is the 2/3 to the 4/5 at Nevins to the 6 at Union Square, which takes half an hour. Even someone optimizing for fewest transfers doesn't want to wait until midnight. Maybe they would be willing to walk to 7th Ave and take the Q to Union Square, then transfer to the 6. If this takes less than optimize_transfer_penalty seconds, then that's what we'll return.

args.name: batch
args.description: when true, do not use goal direction or stop at the target, build a full SPT

args.name: modes
args.description: The set of TraverseModes that a user is willing to use. Defaults to WALK | TRANSIT.

args.name: allowBikeRental
args.description: Is bike rental allowed?

args.name: boardSlack
args.description: Invariant: boardSlack + alightSlack <= transferSlack.

args.name: alightSlack
args.description: Invariant: boardSlack + alightSlack <= transferSlack.

args.name: minTransferTime
args.description: A global minimum transfer time (in seconds) that specifies the minimum amount of time that must pass between exiting one transit vehicle and boarding another. This time is in addition to time it might take to walk between transit stops. This time should also be overridden by specific transfer timing information in transfers.txt

args.name: nonpreferredTransferPenalty
args.description: Penalty for using a non-preferred transfer

args.name: maxTransfers
args.description: Maximum number of transfers

args.name: startTransitStopId
args.description: A transit stop that this trip must start from

args.name: startTransitTripId
args.description: A trip where this trip must start from (depart-onboard routing)

args.name: claimInitialWait
args.description: The maximum wait time in seconds the user is willing to delay trip start. Only effective in Analyst.

args.name: reverseOptimizeOnTheFly
args.description: When true, reverse optimize this search on the fly whenever needed, rather than reverse-optimizing the entire path when it's done.

args.name: ignoreRealtimeUpdates
args.description: When true, realtime updates are ignored during this search.

args.name: disableRemainingWeightHeuristic
args.description: If true, the remaining weight heuristic is disabled. Currently only implemented for the long distance path service.

args.name: locale
args.description: Locale for returned text

fields.name: gtfsId
fields.description: Agency id

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: Get all alerts active for the agency

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: Get all alerts active for the route

enumValues.name: NO_INFORMATION
enumValues.description: There is no bike information for the trip.

enumValues.name: ALLOWED
enumValues.description: The vehicle being used on this particular trip can accommodate at least one bicycle.

enumValues.name: NOT_ALLOWED
enumValues.description: No bicycles are allowed on this trip.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: Get all alerts active for the pattern

fields.name: alerts
fields.description: Get all alerts active for the trip

enumValues.name: NO_INFORMATION
enumValues.description: There is no accessibility information for the stop.

enumValues.name: POSSIBLE
enumValues.description: At least some vehicles at this stop can be boarded by a rider in a wheelchair.

enumValues.name: NOT_POSSIBLE
enumValues.description: Wheelchair boarding is not possible at this stop.

fields.name: stops
fields.description: Returns all stops that are childen of this station (Only applicable for locationType = 1)

types.name: LocationType
types.description: Identifies whether this stop represents a stop or station.

enumValues.name: STOP
enumValues.description: A location where passengers board or disembark from a transit vehicle.

enumValues.name: STATION
enumValues.description: A physical structure or area that contains one or more stop.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: The trip information comes from the GTFS feed, i.e. no real-time update has been applied.

enumValues.name: UPDATED
enumValues.description: The trip information has been updated, but the trip pattern stayed the same as the trip pattern of the scheduled trip.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The trip has been canceled by a real-time update.

enumValues.name: ADDED
enumValues.description: The trip has been added using a real-time update, i.e. the trip was not present in the GTFS feed.

enumValues.name: MODIFIED
enumValues.description: The trip information has been updated and resulted in a different trip pattern compared to the trip pattern of the scheduled trip.

enumValues.name: CALL_AGENCY
enumValues.description: Must phone agency to arrange pickup / drop off.

enumValues.name: COORDINATE_WITH_DRIVER
enumValues.description: Must coordinate with driver to arrange pickup / drop off.

fields.name: patterns
fields.description: Get all patterns for this alert

fields.name: alertHeaderText
fields.description: Header of alert if it exists

fields.name: alertHeaderTextTranslations
fields.description: Headers of alert in all different translations available notnull

fields.name: alertDescriptionText
fields.description: Long description of alert notnull

fields.name: alertDescriptionTextTranslations
fields.description: Long descriptions of alert in all different translations available notnull

fields.name: alertUrl
fields.description: Url with more information

fields.name: effectiveStartDate
fields.description: When this alert comes into effect

fields.name: effectiveEndDate
fields.description: When this alert is not in effect anymore

types.name: stopAtDistanceConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: date
fields.description: The time and date of travel

fields.name: from
fields.description: The origin

fields.name: to
fields.description: The destination

fields.name: itineraries
fields.description: A list of possible itineraries

fields.name: name
fields.description: For transit stops, the name of the stop. For points of interest, the name of the POI.

fields.name: vertexType
fields.description: Type of vertex. (Normal, Bike sharing station, Bike P+R, Transit stop) Mostly used for better localization of bike sharing and P+R station names

fields.name: lat
fields.description: The latitude of the place.

fields.name: lon
fields.description: The longitude of the place.

fields.name: stop
fields.description: The stop related to the place.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Time that the trip departs.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: Time that the trip arrives.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the trip on this itinerary, in seconds.

fields.name: waitingTime
fields.description: How much time is spent waiting for transit to arrive, in seconds.

fields.name: walkTime
fields.description: How much time is spent walking, in seconds.

fields.name: walkDistance
fields.description: How far the user has to walk, in meters.

fields.name: legs
fields.description: A list of Legs. Each Leg is either a walking (cycling, car) portion of the trip, or a transit trip on a particular vehicle. So a trip where the use walks to the Q train, transfers to the 6, then walks to their destination, has four legs.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The date and time this leg begins.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: The date and time this leg ends.

fields.name: mode
fields.description: The mode (e.g., Walk) used when traversing this leg.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The leg's duration in seconds

fields.name: legGeometry
fields.description: The leg's geometry.

fields.name: agency
fields.description: For transit legs, the transit agency that operates the service used for this leg. For non-transit legs, null.

fields.name: realTime
fields.description: Whether there is real-time data about this Leg

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance traveled while traversing the leg in meters.

fields.name: transitLeg
fields.description: Whether this leg is a transit leg or not.

fields.name: from
fields.description: The Place where the leg originates.

fields.name: to
fields.description: The Place where the leg ends.

fields.name: route
fields.description: For transit legs, the route. For non-transit legs, null.

fields.name: trip
fields.description: For transit legs, the trip. For non-transit legs, null.

fields.name: intermediateStops
fields.description: For transit legs, intermediate stops between the Place where the leg originates and the Place where the leg ends. For non-transit legs, null.

fields.name: length
fields.description: The number of points in the string

fields.name: points
fields.description: The encoded points of the polyline.

inputFields.name: safetyFactor
inputFields.description: For the bike triangle, how important safety is

inputFields.name: slopeFactor
inputFields.description: For the bike triangle, how important slope is

inputFields.name: timeFactor
inputFields.description: For the bike triangle, how important time is

inputFields.name: routes
inputFields.description: Set of preferred agencies by user.

inputFields.name: agencies
inputFields.description: Set of preferred agencies by user.

inputFields.name: otherThanPreferredRoutesPenalty
inputFields.description: Penalty added for using every route that is not preferred if user set any route as preferred. We return number of seconds that we are willing to wait for preferred route.

inputFields.name: routes
inputFields.description: Set of unpreferred routes for given user.

inputFields.name: agencies
inputFields.description: Set of unpreferred agencies for given user.

inputFields.name: routes
inputFields.description: Do not use certain named routes

inputFields.name: agencies
inputFields.description: Do not use certain named agencies

inputFields.name: trips
inputFields.description: Do not use certain named trips

inputFields.name: stops
inputFields.description: Do not use certain stops. See for more information the bannedStops property in the RoutingResource class.

inputFields.name: stopsHard
inputFields.description: Do not use certain stops. See for more information the bannedStopsHard property in the RoutingResource class.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

args.name: skip
args.description: Skipped when true.
